Department of Computer Science
College of Arts & Sciences
The University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
info.occupation: Stephen F. Weiss is a professor of the Department of Computer Science at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill. He received his Ph.D. in 1970 from Cornell University. His research interests include information storage and retrieval, computer-supported cooperative work, and hypertext. Dr. Weiss has won several campus teaching awards: the Tanner Award in 1983; the Computer Science Students Association Teaching Award in 1994-95, and the Board of Governors\' Award for Teaching Excellence in 1997. He was named North Carolina Professor of the Year in 1997 by the Foundation for the Advancement of Teaching and the Council for Advancement and Support of Education. Dr. Weiss served as department chairman from 1989 - 2004
info.summary:

He received his Ph.D. in 1970 from Cornell University. His research interests include information storage and retrieval, computer-supported cooperative work, and hypertext. Dr. Weiss has won several campus teaching awards: the Tanner Award in 1983; the Computer Science Students Association Teaching Award in 1994-95, and the Board of Governors\' Award for Teaching Excellence in 1997. He was named North Carolina Professor of the Year in 1997 by the Foundation for the Advancement of Teaching and the Council for Advancement and Support of Education. Dr. Weiss served as department chairman from 1989 - 2004 in Department of Computer Science
